Comment: Capitalized tags are descriptive, lowercase tags match gnuplot option names

Canvas.Comment: Canvas is the entire area addressable by gnuplot. On a desktop it is a full window; on a plotter, it is a single sheet of paper; in svga mode it is the full monitor screen

Plot.Comment0: A plot contains one "graph". A graph is defined by an abscissa and an ordinate, although these need not actually appear on it.
Plot.Comment1: A graph may contain one or more "lines". A line is a single function or data set. "Line" is also a plotting style. The word will also be used in sense "a line of text"
Plot.title: Plot Title

libgd.Comment: libgd settings work for png, gif, and tif formats
